means: 过分殷勤的，爱管闲事的，爱显示权力的

sentence.Network_en: When people put on uniforms, their attitude becomes more confident and their manner more officious.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们穿上制服后会信心倍增，也更爱管闲事了。

sentence.Network_en: They wouldn't welcome any officious interference from the police.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不会欢迎任何来自警方的横加干涉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Latin officiosus 'obliging', from officium (see office). The original sense was 'performing its function, efficacious', whence 'ready to help or please' (mid 16th cent.), later becoming depreciatory (late 16th cent.)

entry.tran: 好管闲事的；爱指手画脚的
entry.def: If you describe someone as officious, you are critical of them because they are eager to tell people what to do when you think they should not.

example.ex: They wouldn't welcome any officious interference from the police...
example.tran: 他们不会欢迎任何来自警方的横加干涉。

example.ex: When people put on uniforms, their attitude becomes more confident and their manner more officious.
example.tran: 人们穿上制服后会信心倍增，也更爱管闲事了。

means.word_mean: 1. intrusive in a meddling or offensive manner;

sentences.sentence: "bustling about self-importantly making an officious nuisance of himself"
